meanings.definition: To make or become ill or unwell.
meanings.sent1: The smell of rotten food sickens me.
meanings.sent2: The sight of blood can sicken some people.
meanings.sent3: Eating too much candy might sicken your stomach.
meanings.sent4: The thought of failing the test sickens her with worry.
meanings.sent5: The virus can quickly sicken a whole community.

meanings.sent1: The gruesome scene in the movie sickens the audience.
meanings.sent2: The taste of spoiled milk sickens my senses.
meanings.sent3: The slimy texture of the food sickens me.
meanings.sent4: The lies he told sickened her trust in him.
meanings.sent5: The sight of the decaying animal sickens the park visitors.

meanings.sent1: After a long day of work, she sickens of the routine.
meanings.sent2: The hiker sickens of the uphill climb.
meanings.sent3: The student sickens of studying for exams.
meanings.sent4: As the night grew late, fatigue sickened his body.
meanings.sent5: The constant noise of the city sickens him, longing for peace.
